Why do some antivirus software flag the Verus software as "not-a-virus" or "PUP"?

Some antivirus software, such as Avast and Kaspersky, may flag the Verus software as "not-a-virus" or "PUP" (Potentially Unwanted Program) because it is mining software, which may be installed by a third party to exploit your PC. This is a false positive warning, and you can review the resources provided to learn more about these false positives.

How can I verify the safety of the Verus software downloads?

You can verify the safety of the Verus software downloads by checking the VirusTotal detection reports provided for each platform (MacOS, Linux-x86-64, Linux-ARM64, and Windows). These reports show the results of scans by multiple antivirus engines and can help you determine if the software is safe to download and use.
